Experience Software Engineer Intel Corporation June 2011  – Present (4 years 3 months) Israel Senior software engineer at Intel. Head developer of a team that develops horizontal automation infrastructure solutions (server & client) in C# for Intel Wireless group. I am also the maintainer (“gatekeeper”) of the execution system, thus responsible for new features analysis, design, implementation, internal testing, and code quality. I initiated a major change in our execution system that will enable better user experience and will reduce code maintenance time and effort. I was selected to research new architecture and design solutions for our product. I was sent to the USA as a product consultant and guide to a new automation team that was established. I received two recognition awards for my work.  Software Engineer (Student) Intel Corporation November 2008  –  June 2011  (2 years 8 months) Israel Software engineer and test engineer at Intel (student position). I worked in a team developing a simulator for a wireless component named WiMax and writing tests that validate the component’s behavior. The simulator was written in C/C++, and used an SDK tool that was written in C#. In addition, I was responsible for the C# tool based on my previous experience with C#. Summary Started the relationship with my PC when I was a little kid, IRC chats, site managing, building and maintaining game/chat servers for large amount of players and worldwide. 
First language to master was the IRC scripting, leading to numerous other experiences in the networking sphere. The main activities included building bots, managing one of the biggest chat sites in Israel, running 2 sites for scripting and coding along side with partners from all over the world, managing servers, writing articles and tutorials, learning HTML, ASP, TCL and basic networking . Apon starting highschool was accepted to a Software major class, learning by the Cisco CNAP plan, receiving a various knowledge about networking, TCP/IP, sockets, routers configuration and network security. Along side helping in the classes courses and lecturing for other students on the last years at highschool. Before the army had experience as the software/network lead at a small startup company dealing with centralized communication of a Smart House. 
Finishing the army after full 3 year service as a crew commander, while learning various communication technologies including: wired/wireless networks, satlites, radio communication, high frequency communication systems, cellular communication. Was on the task force to test and evaluate the WiMax techology for the IDF which was implemented later. 
 
After and during the army kept my passion for the world of networking and comunication, couple years after, discovered a new interest in the form of finances and stock trades, took courses in techinical analysis and basic/extended trading. These days trying independetly to combine software with stock markets to develop personal traiding tools. 
 
Currently studying Software Engeneering while working at Intel, developing a FW for advanced communications platforms.
